intro: Loeselia scabra, commonly known as the rough loeselia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its hairy, woody stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. Loeselia scabra is often found in fynbos vegetation and is adapted to the region's Mediterranean climate.
